title.rendered: Medical Equipment for Medical Professionals and Uses

content.rendered:
Medical Equipment for Medical Professionals and its Uses, Diagnostic equipment, Durable medical equipment, laboratory equipment

These are the types of Medical Equipment for medical professionals and their uses

Diagnostic Equipment

Diagnostic Equipment is any type of equipment or tools used in a hospital setting for the sole purpose of diagnosing a patient’s condition, based on the symptoms and described by the patient.

Below are some of the most common types of diagnostic equipment used in laboratories and as well in medical clinics:

Medical imaging machines-this is used to create visual representations of the human body’s interior.

Examples are listed below:

  • Radiography (X-ray machine)
  • Computed tomography (CT-Scan)
  • Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI scan)
  • Ultrasound
  • Echocardiography.

Aside from medical imaging machines, there are other devices used for diagnosing patients.

Examples are;

  • Patients scales
  • Stethoscope
  • Dopplers
  • Pulse oximetry

Some Durable Medical Equipment

These types of medical equipment are used for providing therapeutic benefits for certain conditions or illnesses. The use of these types of equipment is prescribed by a physician, which is design to serve a medical purpose.

There are several types of durable medical equipment such as:

  • Manual or elective wheelchairs
  • Hospital beds
  • Walkers, crutches, canes
  • Traction equipment

 

  • Pressure mattresses
  • Insulin pumps
  • Breast pumps
  • Nebulizers
  • Patient lifts
  • Bili light and blankets
  • Kidney machines
  • Stationary or portable oxygen tanks
  • Oxygen concentrator ventilators

Medical laboratory equipment

The use of medical laboratory equipment is often seen in clinics or diagnostic laboratories. This equipment is intended for the analysis of blood, urines, genes, and other biological materials. Below are the most common examples of medical laboratory equipment used in the medical field;

There are as follows;

  • Blood gas analyzers
  • Chemistry analyzers
  • Electrolyte analyzers
  • Differential counters
  • Drug testing analyzers
  • Coagulation analyzers
  • Hematology analyzers
  • Urinalysis analyzers and
  • Microbiological systems

As medical technology continues to develop, you can expect that there will be more types of medical equipment emerging. This is good news to patients who can expect quality medical care and diagnosis utilizing the latest in medical technology.

Life Support Equipment | Medical Equipment for Medical Professionals and its Uses

As the name implies, life-supporting types of equipment there are those devices planned to maintain the bodily function of a patient. Without this device, it will be difficult for the patient’s organ system to function on its own.

Some of the devices are outlined below:

  • Heart-lung machines; also known as cardiopulmonary bypass (CB) devices
  • Medical ventilators
  • Dialysis machine
  • Incubators
